pageTitle: CHSY3 Gene - GeneCards | CHSS3 Protein | CHSS3 Antibody
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {75073=CSS3 is a glycosyltransferase that has both glucuronyltransferase and N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activities (Yada et al., 2003 [PubMed 12907687]).[supplied by OMIM, Mar 2008]}
textBeforeTable: Gene Ontology (GO) - Molecular Function for CHSY3 Gene EC 2.4.1.226 4 EC 2.4.1.175 4 Enzyme Numbers (IUBMB) for CHSY3 Gene CHSS3_HUMAN,Q70JA7 UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot Function: Has both beta-1,3-glucuronic acid and beta-1,4-N-acetylgalactosamine transferase activity. Transfers glucuronic acid (GlcUA) from UDP-GlcUA and N-acetylgalactosamine (GalNAc) from UDP-GalNAc to the non-reducing end of the elongating chondroitin polymer. Specific activity is much reduced compared to CHSY1. CHSS3_HUMAN,Q70JA7 UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot CatalyticActivity: UDP-alpha-D-glucuronate + N-acetyl-beta-D-galactosaminyl-(1->4)-beta-D-glucuronosyl-proteoglycan = UDP + beta-D-glucuronosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-beta-D-galactosaminyl-(1->4)-beta-D-glucuronosyl-proteoglycan CHSS3_HUMAN,Q70JA7 UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot CatalyticActivity: UDP-N-acetyl-alpha-D-galactosamine + beta-D-glucuronosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-beta-D-galactosaminyl-proteoglycan = UDP + N-acetyl-beta-D-galactosaminyl-(1->4)-beta-D-glucuronosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-beta-D-galactosaminyl-proteoglycan Molecular function for CHSY3 Gene Flow Cytometry In Situ Assay Cell Line Clone
